result.execSummary:
The defendant Jill M Knight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court has no objection to early discharge after 6 months if restitution is paid in full.

Elements
C: DOC

Defendant Jill M Knight in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson. 
James H Fassbender appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters no contest plea. 
Per ADA Fassbender - State has complied with witness responsibilities. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. 
Court orders 15 days jail, imposed/stayed - Huber privileges granted, 1 year probation. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- pay restitution/surcharge 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- Court has no objection to early discharge after 6 months if restitution is paid in full 
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.
